channel.title: Link Rot
channel.itunes:subtitle: A discussion from the intersection of life & technology.
channel.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson
channel.itunes:summary: Link Rot is a discussion held at the intersection of life and technology. Each week we dive into a subject that explores the changes going on in digital technology and the way it affects our lives. We discuss how technology impacts our very humanity and aim to have some fun along the way!
channel.description: Link Rot is a discussion held at the intersection of life and technology. Each week we dive into a subject that explores the changes going on in digital technology and the way it affects our lives. We discuss how technology impacts our very humanity and aim to have some fun along the way!
channel.webMaster: info@linkrot.net (Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson)

itunes:owner.itunes:name: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson

item.title: Can someone explain drones to me?
item.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson
item.itunes:subtitle: Link Rot: Can someone explain drones to me?
item.itunes:summary: Episode 6 - We talk drones and ask are they toys or something more sinister?
item.description: Episode 6 - We talk drones and ask are they toys or something more sinister? Drones seem to be the big thing at the moment but with a battery life of about 20 minutes usage is pretty short. So why are they touted as the next big thing? Show Notes Available at http://linkrot.net/2016/episode-6.html.

item.title: Learning for Free
item.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson
item.itunes:subtitle: Link Rot: Learning for Free
item.itunes:summary: Episode 5 - We discuss the potential of the web to Learn for free
item.description: Episode 5 - We discuss the potential of the web to Learn for free The internet is an amazing resource of free and available content - so how can we utilise that to learn? Show Notes Available at http://linkrot.net/2016/episode-5.html.
item.itunes:keywords: tools, web, stack overflow, cloud, labour, uber, facebook,

item.title: Hiding Behind Technology
item.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson
item.itunes:subtitle: Link Rot: Hiding Behind Technology
item.itunes:summary: Episode 4 - We discuss what does digital technology hide?
item.description: Episode 4 - We discuss what does digital technology hide? Digital technology represents an abstraction from the real world. It technical and programatic nature allow it to hide and conceal what's really happening in our world. Show Notes Available at http://linkrot.net/2016/episode-4.html.
item.itunes:keywords: technology, VR, refugees, cloud, labour, uber, facebook,

item.title: Will Netflix kill TV?
item.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson
item.itunes:subtitle: Link Rot: Will Netflix kill TV?
item.itunes:summary: Episode 3 - We ask the question - will Netflix kill TV?
item.description: Episode 3 - We ask the question - will Netflix kill TV? The power of TV has been dwindling over recent years. So will the experience of Netflix kill off TV? Show Notes Available at http://linkrot.net/2016/episode-3.html.

item.title: The Physicality of Stuff
item.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson
item.itunes:subtitle: Link Rot: The Physicality of Stuff
item.itunes:summary: Episode 2 - We asking what happens when physical stuff is replaced by the digital.
item.description: Episode 2 - We asking what happens when physical stuff is replaced by the digital. More and more of our lives are becoming digitised - digital objects without a physical equivalent or presence. What kind of effect does this have on us - our identity and how we navigate our history? Show Notes Available at http://linkrot.net/2016/episode-2.html.
item.itunes:keywords: Stuff, Physical Objects, DVDs, Photos, Identity

item.title: Boring iPhones & Digital Death
item.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor, Adam Webster & Ben Atkinson
item.itunes:subtitle: Link Rot: Boring iPhones & Digital Death
item.itunes:summary: Our first episode and we tackle just how boring new technology is and what death looks like in the digital age.
item.description: Our first episode and we tackle just how boring new technology is and what death looks like in the digital age. Join Tim, Ben and Adam for this, the first episode, as we discuss some of the things passing us by at the intersection of life and technology. Show Notes Available at http://linkrot.net/2016/episode-1.html.
